content: pattern for iris stitch scarf for this pattern i used sirdar shawlie in the name peony with a 4mm because i don t have a 3 75mm one however this pattern will work with any yarn with any hook if you change the number of starting chains this pattern is written in uk terms with us terms in the brackets ©crochetyourheartaway start with a chain of a multiple of 4 +3 at the end for my scarf i chained 44 and then added 3 for a total of 47 this chain 3 counts at the first treble_crochet double_crochet into the 5th stitch from the hook 2tr 1ch 2tr 2dc 1ch 2dc into the same stitch skip 3 repeat 2tr 1ch 2tr 2dc 1ch 2dc and skip 3 until the final 2 chains skip the next chain and into the last chain put 1tr 1dc chain 3 and turn this chain 3 counts as a treble_crochet double_crochet in the 1ch space of cluster below 2tr 1ch 2tr 2dc 1ch 2dc repeat this into each of the 1ch spaces from the clusters below after the final 1ch space place 1tr 1dc into the top chain of the turning chain repeat chain 3 and turn this chain 3 counts as a treble_crochet double_crochet in the 1ch space of cluster below 2tr 1ch 2tr 2dc 1ch 2dc repeat this into each of the 1ch spaces from the clusters below after the final 1ch space place 1tr 1dc into the top chain of the turning chain until you reach the desired length of the scarf with thanks to @artby_sree for pattern testing for me
